item.title: Bulletin updated at 14:02 HKT 25/09/2022
item.description:
At 2 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 32 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 60 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 7
Intensity of UV radiation : high

According to the present forecast track, Tropical Cyclone Noru over the east of the Philippines will enter the South China Sea in the early morning tomorrow (26 September). It will move across the central part of the South China Sea towards the vicinity of the central part of Vietnam in the following couple of days. Noru is expected to keep a distance of around 700 kilometres from Hong Kong. Its direct threat to the territory is not high. However, under the influence of the northeast monsoon, east to northeasterly winds will prevail in the territory on Tuesday (27 September) and Wednesday (28 September). It will be windy with a few showers. The Observatory will closely monitor the development and movement of Noru. Members of the public please pay attention to the latest weather information.

Hot weather might cause adverse health effects. The public should stay on the alert and drink more water.

Please be reminded that:
The Fire Danger Warning is Yellow and the fire risk is high.
